title: Gravitational field - field of two-object system

content.question: A two-object system consists of a solid sphere of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and radius <math alttext="r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> located at the center of a thin spherical shell of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and outer radius <math alttext="3 r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> as shown. Calculate the ratio of the gravitational field of the system at a point <math alttext="2 r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the center to the gravitational field of the system at point located <math alttext="4 r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the center.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
